identificationModule.briefTitle: Safety and Efficacy of Remote Ischemic Conditioning Combined With Intravenous Thrombolysis for Acute Ischemic Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Safety and Efficacy of Remote Ischemic Conditioning Combined With Intravenous Thrombolysis for Acute Ischemic Stroke: A Multicenter, Randomized, Parallel-controlled Clinical Trial

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to determine the efficacy and safety of remote ischemic conditioning combined with intravenous thrombolysis in treating acute ischemic stroke.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: In this study, 558 cases of ischemic stroke who undergo intravenous thrombolysis within 4.5 hours from the onset are included in 13 centers in China according to the principle of random, and parallel control. The experimental group receive basic treatment and remote ischemic conditioning for 200mmHg, 2 times per day for 7 consecutive days. The control group receive basic treatment and remote ischemic conditioning control for 60mmHg, 2 times per day for 7 consecutive days. Two groups will be followed up for 90 days to evaluate the efficacy and safety of remote ischemic conditioning combined with intravenous thrombolysis in treating acute ischemic stroke.

armGroups.label: RIC+Standard medical treatment
armGroups.description: RIC+Standard medical treatment Remote ischemic conditioning (RIC) is induced by 4 cycles of 5 min of healthy upper limb ischemia followed by 5 min reperfusion. Limb ischemia was induced by inflation of a blood pressure cuff to 200 mm Hg. RIC will be conducted twice daily for 7 consecutive days from thrombolysis. Additionally, the patients will be treated with standard medical treatment according to the Guidelines for diagnosis and treatment of acute ischemic stroke in China 2014.

armGroups.label: Sham RIC+Standard medical treatment
armGroups.description: Sham RIC+Standard medical treatment Remote ischemic conditioning (RIC) is induced by 4 cycles of 5 min of healthy upper limb ischemia followed by 5 min reperfusion. Limb ischemia was induced by inflation of a blood pressure cuff to 60 mm Hg. RIC will be conducted twice daily for 7 consecutive days from thrombolysis. Additionally, the patients will be treated with standard medical treatment according to the Guidelines for diagnosis and treatment of acute ischemic stroke in China 2014.
